TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509SigningCredentials extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials

Docs.summary: Represents an X.509 token used as the signing credential.
Initializes a new instance of the class based on a specified X.509 certificate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified X.509 certificate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, this constructor uses an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> to generate the security key identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier ski) cil managed
Public Sub New (certificate As X509Certificate2, ski As SecurityKeyIdentifier)

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified X.509 certificate and security key identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The key identifier clause types supported by Windows Communication Foundation for generating a security key identifier that references an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>. However, in order to enable custom scenarios, this constructor does not perform any validation on the clause types that were used to generate the security key identifier supplied in the `ski` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public X509SigningCredentials (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm) cil managed

public: X509SigningCredentials(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2 ^ certificate, System::String ^ signatureAlgorithm, System::String ^ digestAlgorithm);

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified X.509 certificate, signature algorithm, and digest algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, this constructor uses an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause> to generate the security key identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: public X509SigningCredentials (System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier ski, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier ski, string signatureAlgorithm, string digestAlgorithm) cil managed
Public Sub New (certificate As X509Certificate2, ski As SecurityKeyIdentifier, signatureAlgorithm As String, digestAlgorithm As String)

public: X509SigningCredentials(System::Security::Cryptography::X509Certificates::X509Certificate2 ^ certificate, System::IdentityModel::Tokens::SecurityKeyIdentifier ^ ski, System::String ^ signatureAlgorithm, System::String ^ digestAlgorithm);

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified X.509 certificate, security key identifier, signature algorithm, and digest algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The key identifier clause types supported by Windows Communication Foundation for generating a security key identifier that references an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>. However, in order to enable custom scenarios, this constructor does not perform any validation on the clause types that were used to generate the security key identifier supplied in the `ski` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Certificate As X509Certificate2
